attributes.comment:
We are in the process of adopting from China. We will have to have a second
round of fingerprinting before we will be able to travel to China and pick up our
child. In addition to the increased costs, for us that means my 87 year old
mother, who lives with us, will need to be fingerprinted. This retired school
teacher had to travel downtown to be fingerprinted twice EVEN though the
computer approved the prints. Through the FBI, she had to be fingerprinted three
times. It would appear to be a waste of your agency's time to not have
accomodations for such situations. The time frame and the cost should be re-
evaluated to determine if there is a lower cost, longer time period for the
approvals. People trying to adopt are not a terrorist threat, just hopeful that the
next hoop we jump through will bring us our child.
Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Barbara J. Matz
